verses.verse: My son<WH1121>, keep<WH8104> my words<WH561>, and lay up<WH6845> my commandments with you<WH4687>.
Keep<WH8104> my commandments<WH4687>, and live<WH2421>; and my law<WH8451> as the apple<WH380> of your eye<WH5869>.
Bind<WH7194> them upon your fingers<WH676>, write<WH3789> them upon the table<WH3871> of your heart<WH3820>.
Say<WH559> unto wisdom<WH2451>, You are my sister<WH269>; and call<WH7121> understanding<WH998> your kinswoman<WH4129>:
That they may keep<WH8104> you from the strange<WH2114> woman<WH802>, from the stranger<WH5237> which flatters<WH2505> with her words<WH561>.
For at the window<WH2474> of my house<WH1004> I looked<WH8259> through my lattice<WH822>,
And looked<WH7200> among the simple ones<WH6612>, I discerned<WH995> among the youths<WH1121>, a young man<WH5288> void<WH2638> of understanding<WH3820>,
Passing through<WH5674> the street<WH7784> near<WH681> her corner<WH6434>; and he went<WH6805> the way<WH1870> to her house<WH1004>,
In the twilight<WH5399>, in the evening<WH3117>, in the black<WH380> and dark<WH653> night<WH3915>:
And<WH7125>, behold, there met him a woman<WH802> with the attire<WH7897> of a prostitute<WH2181>, and subtle<WH5341> of heart<WH3820>.
(She is loud<WH1993> and stubborn<WH5637>; her feet<WH7272> stay<WH7931> not in her house<WH1004>:
Now<WH6471> is she outside<WH2351>, now<WH6471> in the streets<WH7339>, and lies in wait<WH693> at<WH681> every corner<WH6438>.)
So she caught<WH2388> him<WH5401>, and kissed him<WH5810>, and with a impudent face<WH6440> said unto him<WH559>,
I have peace<WH8002> offerings<WH2077> with me<WH3117>; this day have I payed<WH7999> my vows<WH5088>.
Therefore came I forth<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> you<WH7836>, diligently to seek your face<WH6440>, and I have found you<WH4672>.
I have decked<WH7234> my bed<WH6210> with coverings<WH4765> of tapestry<WH2405>, with carved works<WH330>, with fine linen of Egypt<WH4714>.
I have perfumed<WH5130> my bed<WH4904> with myrrh<WH4753>, aloes<WH174>, and cinnamon<WH7076>.
Come<WH3212>, let us take our fill<WH7301> of love<WH1730> until the morning<WH1242>: let us solace<WH5965> ourselves with loving<WH159>.
For the goodman<WH376> is not at home<WH1004>, he is gone<WH1980> a long<WH7350> journey<WH1870>:
He has taken<WH3947> a bag<WH6872> of money<WH3701> with him<WH3027>, and will come<WH935> home<WH1004> at the day<WH3117> appointed<WH3677>.
With her much<WH7230> fair speech<WH3948> she caused him to yield<WH5186>, with the flattering<WH2506> of her lips<WH8193> she compelled him<WH5080>.
He goes<WH1980> after<WH310> her directly<WH6597>, as an ox<WH7794> goes<WH935> to the slaughter<WH2874>, or as a fool<WH191> to the correction<WH4148> of the stocks<WH5914>;
Until a dart<WH2671> strikes<WH6398> through his liver<WH3516>; as a bird<WH6833> hastes<WH4116> to the snare<WH6341>, and knows<WH3045> not that it is for his life<WH5315>.
Listen<WH8085> unto me now therefore<WH1121>, O you sons, and attend<WH7181> to the words<WH561> of my mouth<WH6310>.
Let not your heart<WH3820> decline<WH7847> to her ways<WH1870>, go not astray<WH8582> in her paths<WH5410>.
For she has cast down<WH5307> many<WH7227> wounded<WH2491>: Yes<WH6099>, many strong men have been slain by her<WH2026>.
Her house<WH1004> is the way<WH1870> to hell<WH7585>, going down<WH3381> to the chambers<WH2315> of death<WH4194>.
